bullets.text: FAA warns flight cancellations will worsen next week if shutdown persists, pressuring airlines, airports, and travel-dependent sectors.
Supreme Court SNAP ruling leaves benefits uncertain amid shutdown, risking food insecurity and reduced local spending in many communities.
China’s CPI returned to growth in October, while PPI deflation hit three years, signaling weak industrial demand despite consumer stabilization.
Treasury bonds seen attractive near-term due to technical and seasonal factors, not Fed policy, supporting duration allocations.
Berkshire’s cash-rich portfolio narrowed gap with S&P 500 as AI-led tech sold off, underscoring defensive advantages in volatile markets.
State Street cautions it’s too early to fade AI trade, citing resilient earnings and positioning despite Nasdaq’s worst week since April.
ACA “subsidy cliff” looms amid shutdown, threatening premium spikes and coverage losses that could squeeze household budgets and healthcare demand.
OpenAI pushed to expand Chips Act tax credits to data centers, signaling costly AI infrastructure needs and intensifying policy fights over subsidies.
Investment in submarine cables is booming to meet AI and internet bandwidth, making subsea infrastructure a strategic bottleneck and opportunity.
Merck’s oral PCSK9 inhibitor achieved extremely low LDL cholesterol, potentially reshaping cardiovascular therapy and challenging statins.
New laser therapy aims to prevent vision loss before onset, offering cost-effective intervention for diseases like diabetic retinopathy and AMD.
MIT quantum advance inches toward room-temperature superconductivity, promising transformative gains in energy transmission, computing, and magnets if scalable.
Laser satellites detected an Antarctic carbon release, suggesting previously underestimated feedbacks that could complicate climate targets and policy.
Deep-sea mining found to starve life in the ocean’s twilight zone, bolstering calls for stricter environmental regulation.
Study flags weaknesses in AI evaluation methods, raising reliability concerns for regulators and investors.
